docs.getting_started.description: Ready to start building your application? Check out the installation guide to set up your first project.
docs.getting_started.title: Getting Started
docs.installation.app_scripts.desc: You can also run scripts for specific apps or packages:
docs.installation.config: The Monorepo Starter Kit comes with sensible default configurations, but you can customize them as needed.
docs.installation.description: Learn how to install and set up the Monorepo Starter Kit
docs.installation.env: Create a .env file in your app root directory based on the .env.example file:
docs.installation.next: Now that you have installed the Monorepo Starter Kit, you can start building your application. Check out the following guides:
docs.installation.note.content: We strongly recommend using pnpm as your package manager when working with the Monorepo Starter Kit. Other package managers like npm or Yarn may work but are not officially supported.
docs.installation.note.title: Note
docs.installation.option1.after: This will create a new directory called my-app and set everything up for you. Once the installation is complete, you can navigate to the directory and start the development server:
docs.installation.option1.desc: The easiest way to get started is to use our create-monorepo tool:
docs.installation.option2.desc: Alternatively, you can clone the repository directly from GitHub:
docs.installation.options: There are two ways to set up a new project with the Monorepo Starter Kit:
docs.installation.prerequisites: Before installing the Monorepo Starter Kit, ensure you have the following installed on your system:
docs.installation.root_scripts.dev: Starts the development server for all applications
docs.installation.root_scripts.lint: Runs linting for all applications and packages
docs.installation.root_scripts.test: Runs tests for all applications and packages
docs.installation.scripts: In the project directory, you can run the following commands:
docs.installation.structure: After installation, your project should have the following structure:
docs.installation.tailwind: You can customize the Tailwind configuration in the tailwind.config.mjs file in each app directory.
docs.installation.tip.content: If you plan to push this to your own repository, remember to update the remote origin:
docs.installation.tip.title: Tip
docs.installation.title: Installation
docs.key_features.components: Shared Components - Reusable UI library with Shadcn UI components
docs.key_features.dx: Developer Experience - Hot module replacement and fast refresh for improved development experience
docs.key_features.i18n: Internationalization - Built-in i18n support for multilingual applications
docs.key_features.performance: Performance Optimization - Built-in best practices for optimal application performance
docs.key_features.quality: Code Quality - Integrated ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript configurations
docs.key_features.workspace: Workspace Management - Efficient package management with PNPM workspaces
docs.monorepo_description: Our Monorepo Starter Kit provides a structured foundation that follows best practices for React application development, making it easier to manage large codebases with multiple integrated packages.
docs.not_found.description: The documentation page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.
docs.project_structure.app_structure: Each application follows a standardized structure to ensure consistency. Here's the structure for the main web application:
docs.project_structure.apps: The apps directory contains individual applications, each with its own build configuration, dependencies, and deployment settings.
docs.project_structure.best_practice.con: Keep common dependencies in the root package.json to ensure version consistency across packages.
docs.project_structure.config_files: The monorepo contains various configuration files:
docs.project_structure.dependency: Dependencies are managed both at the root level and within individual packages:
docs.project_structure.dependency.desc1: Root-level dependencies are available to all packages
docs.project_structure.dependency.desc2: Package-specific dependencies are defined in the package's package.json
docs.project_structure.dependency.desc3: Workspace packages can be referenced using the workspace:* syntax
docs.project_structure.description: Understand the organizational structure of the Monorepo Starter Kit
docs.project_structure.directory: At the root level, the monorepo is organized into the following directories:
docs.project_structure.overview: The Monorepo Starter Kit is organized to support multiple applications and shared packages. This structure allows for efficient code sharing while maintaining separation of concerns.
docs.project_structure.packages: The packages directory contains shared code that can be imported by different applications.
docs.project_structure.title: Project Structure
docs.routing.description: Set up navigation in your application
docs.title: Documentation
docs.welcome.subtitle: Welcome to the Monorepo Starter Kit documentation. This guide will help you understand how to build modern, scalable web applications using our toolkit.
docs.welcome.title: Introduction
docs.what_is_monorepo.description: A monorepo (monolithic repository) is a software development strategy where code for multiple projects is stored in the same repository. This approach has become increasingly popular for organizing complex web applications.
docs.why_use.docs.description: Detailed guides and API references to help you make the most of the toolkit.
docs.why_use.fast.description: Skip the boilerplate and start building features right away with our pre-configured setup.
docs.why_use.flexible.description: Easily customize and extend the toolkit to meet your specific project requirements.
docs.why_use.scalable.description: Designed to scale with your project, from small applications to large enterprise systems.
public.about.cta_desc: Be part of our growing community of developers building amazing applications with our toolkit.
public.about.jane_bio: Jane is a full-stack developer with a passion for creating elegant and efficient solutions to complex problems.
public.about.john_bio: John has over 15 years of experience in software development and has previously founded two successful startups.
public.about.mike_bio: Mike specializes in frontend development and has contributed to several open-source projects.
public.about.mission_desc1: We believe that developers should be able to focus on creating awesome features instead of setting up infrastructure.
public.about.mission_desc2: Our goal is to provide a comprehensive toolkit that handles the boilerplate and configuration, allowing you to jumpstart your projects and focus on what matters.
public.about.mission_desc3: We're committed to open source and giving back to the community that has given us so much.
public.about.mission_quote: We're not just building tools, we're building a foundation for the next generation of web applications.
public.about.placeholder: This is a placeholder for the About page. You can implement your own content here.
public.about.team_subtitle: Meet the people behind the Monorepo Starter Kit
public.about.title: About Us
public.contact.faq.bug_report: How can I report a bug?
public.contact.faq.bug_report_answer: Bugs can be reported through our GitHub issues page or by contacting our support team. Please include detailed steps to reproduce the issue and any relevant information about your environment.
public.contact.faq.customization_answer: Yes, we provide customization services for Enterprise customers. Please reach out to our sales team to discuss your specific requirements and get a custom quote.
public.contact.faq.response_time: How quickly will I receive a response?
public.contact.faq.response_time_answer: For general inquiries, we aim to respond within 24 hours during business days. Technical support requests are typically addressed within 48 hours, with faster response times for priority issues.
public.contact.faq.support_options_answe: We offer email support for all plans, with priority response times for Professional and Enterprise customers. Enterprise customers also receive dedicated support channels.
public.contact.placeholder: This is a placeholder for the Contact page. You can implement your own contact form here.
public.contact.thank_you: Thank you for your message! We'll get back to you shortly.
public.contact.title: Contact Us
public.features.categories.core.desc: The foundation of our monorepo toolkit
public.features.core.monorepo.desc: Organized project structure for maintainable and scalable code. Share code between packages with ease.
public.features.core.monorepo.title: Monorepo Architecture
public.features.core.typescript.desc: Type-safe development with modern JavaScript features and improved developer experience.
public.features.core.typescript.title: TypeScript
public.features.core.vite.desc: Lightning-fast development environment with hot module replacement and optimized builds.
public.features.core.vite.title: Vite-Powered
public.features.cta.subtitle: Start building your next project with our comprehensive toolkit and focus on what matters most - your application logic.
public.features.cta.title: Ready to Build Something Amazing?
public.features.dev.api.desc: Pre-configured API client with interceptors for authentication and error handling.
public.features.dev.api.title: API Integration
public.features.dev.dashboard.desc: Ready-to-use dashboard and admin interfaces with responsive layouts.
public.features.dev.dashboard.title: Dashboard & Admin
public.features.dev.hot.desc: Instant feedback during development with fast refresh for React components.
public.features.dev.hot.title: Hot Reloading
public.features.everything.subtitle: A comprehensive toolkit for building modern web applications with all the essential features.
public.features.int.docs.desc: Comprehensive documentation and usage examples for quick onboarding.
public.features.int.docs.title: Documentation
public.features.int.i18n.desc: Internationalization with dynamic language switching and locale detection.
public.features.int.i18n.title: i18n Support
public.features.int.responsive.desc: Mobile-first approach ensuring great user experience on all devices.
public.features.int.responsive.title: Responsive Design
public.features.subtitle: Discover everything the Monorepo Starter Kit offers to accelerate your development workflow and build modern, responsive applications.
public.features.title: Features & Capabilities
public.features.ui.accessibility.desc: ARIA-compliant components with keyboard navigation and screen reader support.
public.features.ui.accessibility.title: Accessibility
public.features.ui.darkmode.desc: Built-in dark mode support with automatic detection of user preferences.
public.features.ui.darkmode.title: Dark Mode
public.features.ui.tailwind.desc: Utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom designs with consistent styling.
public.features.ui.tailwind.title: Tailwind CSS
public.footer.description: Multi-package monorepo starter for Vite, React, Tailwind, and TypeScript.
public.hero.title: A Monorepo Starter for Vite, React, Tailwind, and TypeScript
public.landing.hero.subtitle: A comprehensive development toolkit for modern web applications. Get started in minutes, no setup required.
public.landing.newsletter.subtitle: Subscribe to our newsletter for the latest updates and features
public.landing.newsletter.title: Stay Updated
public.pricing.cta.choose: Choose the plan that fits your needs and start building amazing applications today.
public.pricing.faq.discount.answer: Yes, we offer special pricing for non-profits, educational institutions, and open-source projects. Please contact our sales team for more information.
public.pricing.faq.discount.question: Is there a discount for non-profits or educational institutions?
public.pricing.faq.free.answer: The Community plan includes the basic monorepo structure, Vite development server, React & TypeScript setup, and basic UI components. It's perfect for personal projects and learning.
public.pricing.faq.free.question: What is included in the free plan?
public.pricing.faq.refund.answer: We offer a 14-day money-back guarantee for all paid plans. If you're not satisfied with your purchase, contact our support team within 14 days for a full refund.
public.pricing.faq.refund.question: Do you offer refunds?
public.pricing.faq.subtitle: Have questions? We've got answers.
public.pricing.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
public.pricing.faq.upgrade.answer: Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time. When upgrading, you'll get immediate access to additional features. When downgrading, changes will take effect at the end of your current billing cycle.
public.pricing.faq.upgrade.question: Can I upgrade my plan later?
public.pricing.plan.community.desc: Perfect for personal projects and learning
public.pricing.plan.enterprise.desc: For large teams and organizations with custom needs
public.pricing.plan.professional.desc: For individuals and small teams building applications
public.pricing.subtitle: Choose the plan that's right for you and start building your next project with our monorepo starter.
public.pricing.title: Simple, Transparent Pricing
